pr_title: feat(clients/java): add capability to change ZeebeObjectMapper

timeline.message: feat(clients/java): create ZeebeObjectMapperWrapper and use it instead of ZeebeObjectMapper
feat(clients/java): create JsonMapper and make ZeebeObjectMapper implement in

timeline.bodyText: As this is a public interface which users are meant to implement, it's important to fully document it.
timeline.author: npepinpe

timeline.author: npepinpe

timeline.message: feat(clients/java): code review: add more JavaDocs and remove unused property

timeline.bodyText: As a user, this doesn't tell me much about the interface. What objects are transformed to JSON? When are they transformed? Why would I want to implement this (ideally with examples - everybody loves examples 🙂)? What is the default implementation (I know you link to ZeebeObjectMapper, but it's not apparent to a user why)?
timeline.author: npepinpe
timeline.diffHunk:

replies.bodyText: Another point: our ZeebeObjectMapper implementation always throws InternalClientException on error. We could also document the interface methods (i.e. @throws InternalClientException on serialization/deserialization error), even without adding the checked exception. That way implementations are more easily swappable.
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * Transform a JSON string to the typed object.
          
          
            
               * Deserializes a JSON string into an equivalent POJO of type {@code T}.
          
      
    
    
  

I think this is more indicative of the intent, i.e. deserialization.

+package io.zeebe.client.api;
+
+import java.io.InputStream;
+import java.util.Map;
+
+/**
+ * This interface is using to customize the way how objects will be transformed in JSON format.
+ *
+ * @see io.zeebe.client.impl.ZeebeObjectMapper
+ */
+public interface JsonMapper {
+
+  /**
+   * Transform a JSON string to the typed object.
+   *
+   * @param json a JSON string
+   * @param typeClass a class of the type to serialize
+   * @param <T> a type of the returned object
+   * @return a typed object from a JSON string
